Definition of Terms

Source: vignettes/term_definitions.Rmd
term_definitions.Rmd

Introduction

This vignette serves to define terms used in both the code and documentation of this package, and includes some discussion on terms that are commonly used in the Bulk Segregant Analysis (BSA) and Quantitative Trait Locus (QTL) literature which I chose to re-name in this package.

QTL-seq Terms

The terms below are derived from Takagi et al. (2013)

Traditional Term Term Used in This Package Description/Notes
Bulk (Low, High) population_1, population_2 population refers to a group of samples pooled together for sequencing. See also \(\Delta\)(SNP-Index) below
SNP-Index snp_index The ratio of the number of reads containing the alternate allele to the total number of reads at a SNP.
\(\Delta\)(SNP-Index) delta_snp_index The difference in alt allele frequency between population_2 and population_1, i.e. population_2_snp_index - population_1_snp_index

BSA Statistics Terms

The terms below are derived from Magwene (2011)

Traditional Term Term Used in This Package Description/Notes
G g lower case for consistency within code
G’ g_smoothed This is the result of local regression smoothing on the G metric. delta_snp_index_smoothed is the equivalent metric calculated on delta_snp_index
